resources.string: Degree Tracking allows you to keep track of your degree progress.

Laurum is designed to provide Wilfrid Laurier University students from both the Brantford and Waterloo campuses helpful tools in one app.

There are 5 pages: Degree, Courses, Faculty, Resources, and Settings. You can move between them by pressing the appropriate icon on the menu bar. When you open the app, you start on the Degree page.

Degree
This page is for you to track progress through your degree credits and see it in a progress bar. You can modify how many credits you start with and need in Settings under the Degree Tracker Settings category. You can add additional courses by pressing the add button and searching for courses. This search bar is affected by Course Search under the Search Settings category in Settings. Courses you add are displayed in Degree as buttons in a list. Pressing the course displays its details. Filling in the 'Completed\’ checkbox adds the credit value of that course to the amount of credits you have completed, and unchecking it undoes this action. Press the \‘x\’ in the corner to remove the course, which will also remove its credit contribution if it was marked as completed. You are allowed to finish more credits than you need.

Courses
This page shows you a list of all courses and has a search bar for you to look for specific courses. Each course is a button and pressing it displays the Course ID, Course Title, Credits, and Description. You can filter for specific courses by typing in the search bar. This search bar is affected by Course Search under the Search Settings category in Settings.

Faculty
This page shows you a list of all faculty and has a search bar for you to look for specific members. Each person is a button and pressing it displays their Name, Title, Department, and E-Mail. Some members may have empty fields. Pressing \‘EMAIL\’ will prompt you to open an email app where the recipient is the faculty member you have selected. You can filter for specific faculty members by typing in the search bar. This search bar is affected by Faculty Search under the Search Settings category in Settings.

Resources
This page provides a list of links to helpful resources that the university provides. Each resource is a button containing a title and description. Pressing it will prompt you to select a browser to open the link in.

Settings
Settings allow you to set filters and customize the app to better fit your needs.

Degree Tracker Settings are for modifying credit values for the Degree page. Starting Credits is by default 0 and Total Required Credits is by default 20.0. Both values can be set to any positive number. Starting Credits can be higher than Total Required Credits. Search Settings put a filter on search bars for courses and faculty. By default, there is no filter and text searched up will be matched with all text associated with the appropriate subject. Course Search adds the following filters to the search in the Degree and Courses page: Course ID, Course Title, Course Description. Faculty Search adds the following filters to the search in the Faculty page: Name, Title, Department. Filters can be removed by selecting the \‘All\’ option under each set of filter options.

App Details contains information about the app, such as a brief description of features offered by Laurum, a link to the Laurum GitHub repository, the developers\’ names, and the current version of the app.

Version:
1.0.0
